name: Open Jam
description: Jamspace Open Jam: Strawberry

name: Mega Man-athon: Pre-Show
description: If we start on time this year, we might actually do this! Come early to watch us get ready and hype up the beginning of our 72 hour Mega Man Marathon to raise money for Child's Play!

name: Open and Guided Jams
description:
Bring your instrument (or try our in-house gear), grab a microphone, and get ready to jam with our highly-talented staff and guests! Or just swing by and enjoy the live music! Not sure where to start, or want to brush up on your chops? We have workshops scheduled throughout the weekend for all skill levels.

Note: time ranges for Open and Guided Jams may vary slightly due to scheduled events in the Jam Clinic and Jam Shop.

~~~

The Jam Clinic is a musician-to-musician education venue at the Music and Gaming Festival (MAGFest), dedicated to co-mentoring participants on how to play and improvise within genres such as jazz fusion, funk, and rock, as well as popular video game music.

We strive to teach participants and empower them with the language of musical communication, while embracing a leadership-centered, technology-powered, challenging, and fun atmosphere for our visitors.

name: For those who are about to rock we educate you.
description: One dose not simply go to a concert every week. But you can. Come and learn some advice to help you go to more concerts outside of MAGFest. Without destroying yourself or your bank account.

name: Mega Man X2
description:
Starting off the Mega Man-athon is KayeXP playing Mega Man X2!

Noon to 1:30PM

name: Armour Academy: Chainmail!
description:
Want to learn how to make chainmail? Well good news! It's not that hard! 
In this panel, we will teach the traditional European four-in-one weave, used for armor from the Roman Empire through middle ages, and send you home with a small piece forged by your own hands.
There will be a fifteen dollar materials fee to participate in this panel, but any may observe for free.

name: To End All Wars: Battlefield 1 And The First World War
description: After almost two years since launch, Battlefield 1 has presented The First World War to millions of gamers across the globe. But how does it portray the war compared to the real thing? How can a video game show the defining event of the 20th century? And what can we learn from this war today, a hundred years later? Join a man who willingly calls himself “Derp” on the Internet as we delve into the horrors and humanity of what has been ironically called The War To End All Wars.

name: Mastering Your Dungeons: Making D&D Adventures Like a Boss!
description: Maps, traps, monsters, and mazes! Dastardly plots and secret places! What makes for a memorable Dungeons & Dragons adventure? How do you design a dungeon to entertain and delight? Join the Mythmakers team as we present tips and tricks on how to create D&D adventures that your players will rave about!

name: MITS Opens
description:
Come play and see games made by indie developers in various stages of development from playable prototype to complete project!

MITS will close again at 4am.

name: How To Swadge! Use your electronic badge for good not evil!
description:
What is this crazy MAGFest circuit board?  How do I use it?  What features does it have? An overview of the work that goes into creating the swadges, including mechanical, circuit, and firmware design. Come and ask the creators anything. You can even ask about the secret code, but don't expect an answer!

We are mostly _not_ techops now.  Techops kind of wanted to divorce from swadges.

But sure...

Swadges are in their third year now, and are all designed, engineered and programmed in-house by MAGFest volunteers.  If you are interested in helping out with swadges in future years, join us!  You can email cnlohr@magfest.org

name: Ludomusicology: The Scholarly Study of Video Game Music
description:
What if you could teach and write about video game music for a living? This panel will feature four academics from different backgrounds to discuss video game music as an academic discipline, aka Ludomusicology. We’ll cover our research and hot topics in the field, how it is different from standard journalistic game criticism, and offer resources for getting started. Followed by a Q&A.

Our party of scholars includes:
Dr. Karen Cook, an Assistant Professor of Music History at the University of Hartford, who brings her Medievalist background to bear on medieval-flavored games and their music.

Julianne Grasso (moderator), a PhD Candidate in Music Theory at the University of Chicago, whose dissertation uses music analysis and cognition studies to conceptualize our relationships to game music over the course of play.

Dr. Dana Plank comes from The Ohio State University with a PhD in Musicology and a penchant for 8-bit games. She offers an eclectic blend of approaches to understanding game sound, from disability theory to pornography studies. 

Dr. Ryan Thompson teaches game history and game audio at Michigan State. A bona-fide Twitch teacher with a musicology background, Ryan leads our weekly Ludomusicology Twitch stream, where we discuss game music as it’s happening.

name: Mega Man Zero 3
description:
Tterraj42 of Team BattleNetwork plays through Mega Man Zero 3 while Matt Papa of the games developer, Inti Creates joins him on the couch!

1:40 - 3:10PM

name: Pinball Tournament Registration
description: Register to play in the pinball tournament.

name: Nelward Chipspace Kickoff Concert with your host Nelward
description: Nelward Chipspace Kickoff Concert with your host Nelward!

name: Cosplay 201: Building and Wearing Fursuits and Mascot Costumes
description: While the concepts of cosplay and fursuit making have some overlap, there's special considerations of size, shape, comfort, and construction that go into making a fur or mascot style costume. Join divisionten as she walks you through the basics of foam work, handling fur and other non-standard fabrics, and well as designs considerations to keep the wearer cool and comfortable for as long as possible.

name: When RPGs Go Wrong
description: We have all been there, just started a fresh D&D campaign, you found the weird splat books, or your ready top break out your weird all Monk game. Three weeks in chaos has struck, everyone is either at each other's throats, no one shows up, or perhaps worse, everyone is on their laptop playing side by side single player games. Fear not, with decades of gaming experience, Jordan and Corey will guide you through the dark waters of when Gaming Groups Go Wrong!

name: TASBot and Tool-Assisted Speedruns: A History
description: TASBot is like a player piano for classic video game consoles, sending a predefined sequence of button presses using only controller ports. TASBot plays games faster than any human possibly could and often glitches them beyond all recognition. He relies on humans to create those predefined sequences in the form of Tool-Assisted Speedrun movie files. This talk covers how the very first TAS runs were created and the history of how we got here. Come for the live demos, stay for the breakage and Q&A!

name: Intro to Open Source Game Design and Development
description:
Have you considered making a game as your next side project? In this presentation we will cover basic game design methodology including the ideation process, defining project goals and paper prototypes; review a selection of tools and resources to quickly dive into game development; and discuss events that can help get projects started.

Participants will take away an understanding of what tools and applications exist for making games and gain an understanding of the development process.

name: Making Music on Twitch
description: Twitch.tv, now with music! With the rise of a thriving community on Twitch’s Music and Performing Arts channel, many artists are finding that they have a new home for music creation and streaming. Every day new music creators are coming to Twitch to progress their music, build their audience, and get feedback in real time. The accessibility of Twitch allows for musical ideas from across the globe to converge to create a new generation of musical talent. Come listen to panelists share their experiences working in the creative space and developing music on Twitch.

name: Trauma Team / Center (Wii)
description:
Consoles Tournament 

Please arrive at Consoles Op 15 minutes before start of tournament.

name: How Software Piracy Birthed an Underground Art Scene
description: Have you ever played a pirated game with an "extra" introduction from the folks who broke the copy protection? Or perhaps used a key generator with some rockin' chiptunes? There’s a whole community of individuals who evolved from software hacks to making art under extreme limitations, whether it be 3D graphics on an 8-bit Atari, CD-quality music playback on a Commodore 64, or music videos stored entirely in only kilobytes of space. This presentation will get you up to speed so you can enjoy all of the cool demos we'll be watching over the course of the weekend in the Demoscene room. Presenter: Brendan “Inverse Phase” Becker

name: Iron Jams Overview and Signups (Session 1)
description: Get all the rules and sign up for Iron Jams! You and your team (2-5 people) will be assigned random video game tunes to use as source material in creating your own unique arrangement, which you will have a chance to perform live on Sunday during our judging and feedback panel. If you don't have a team, we will do our best to help you find one. If you miss this sign-up session, we will have a second opportunity on Friday in the Jam Shop.

name: The Chronicles of Bionicle: Story and Trivia
description: Gathered friends, listen again to our legend of the Bionicle. This panel shall cover the original saga, from its humble beginnings in 2001 as the Toa faced off against the Rahi and Bohrok through its grand conclusion in 2011. The panel will be friendly to both die-hard fans and newcomers alike, covering the entire main story while offering trivia intermissions in between sections with opportunities for winning kanohi masks.Gather around and listen again to the tale of the Bionicle. This panel shall cover the classic saga, from its humble beginnings in 2001 as the Toa faced off against the Rahi and Bohrok through its grand conclusion in 2011.

name: Mega Man 9
description:
Matt Papa of IntiCreates plays through their much beloved first attempt at making a classic Mega Man game. 

3:20 - 4:50PM

name: Getting Started with Fuse Beads
description: Fuse beads are a form of pixel art where small beads are placed on a grid to form an image and then melted together with a household iron. If you've ever thought about getting into fuse beads, it's actually really easy, and this workshop will provide you with everything you need to get started.

name: Role Playing Over Roll Playing
description:
Dice should never come between a party of players and the heralding of their adventures!

Yet, Balancing player-created items, homebrew races and classes, and trying to create a new monster stat-block on the fly because your Big Bad got banished on round 2 of combat can be daunting!

This panel will discuss how to navigate some of these intricacies that allow for immersive, unique experiences and player tailored characters and narratives while still having fun playing your campaign, both as a Player Character and a DM!

*Part group lecture, part Q&A*

name: Open Mic
description: Chiptune Open Mic

name: Why Are We Talking about Beethoven at MAGFest?
description: From Beethoven to John Williams to Koji Kondo and Nobuo Uematsu, in this panel we'll bridge the gap between works from the world of classical music to the video games we know and love. By navigating through different waypoints in the classical repertoire, we'll discuss what makes orchestral music so great, dispel some common misconceptions, and learn how the traditions of the past are relevant to gaming today.

name: From 8-Bit to Orchestration: The Historic Development of Video Game Themes
description: Few things capture a sense of adventure like the first moments of booting up ‘The Legend of Zelda’ on the NES. The main theme is heroic, exciting, and open-ended. Fast-forward thirty years later, and the same theme is still prevalent and fresh. This panel will explore the evolution of significant themes in ‘The Legend of Zelda’ series, and look at how they have developed as a result of new stories, new emotions, and new technologies.

name: Mental Health Representation in Games
description: Mental health representation takes many forms in games, and can be helpful or harmful. Games like Hellblade explicitly address psychosis through the use of sound and mechanics, and are highly praised for the care in which they implemented and portrayed this perspective. However, other games may be less careful in their depictions--and reinforce harmful stereotypes. How do tropes such as asylum horror settings, or villains who are labelled “crazy,” implicitly reflect and reinforce harmful ideas about mental health and illness? How can we thoughtfully--and accurately--portray mental health in games, allowing players to empathise and better understand diverse neurodivergent perspectives? In this panel, we will discuss these questions and more, delving into our favorite examples of mental health representation in games, as well as tropes and ideas to avoid.

name: Gaming with your kids
description: In this round table, an open, moderated discussion will be held around the topic of gaming while being a parent. What games do you play with your kids? What are the rules in your house? When is it too early to play certain titles? How do you moderate your kids screen time?  Conversation amongst participants is encouraged.

name: Bringing Characters to Life
description: This short lecture style discussion breaks down the typical parts of a character sheet for tabletop role playing games and helps showcase how these aspects can be used for therapeutic direction and clinical use of gaming.  We'll talk about how The Bodhana Group has used role playing for therapy and treatment through the presentation.

name: One Man Star Wars: Return of the Jedi
description: Alexander Brandon performs, using nothing but his voice, the iconic film Star Wars: Return of the Jedi. Get ready for a zany combination of Mystery Science Theater 3000 with Rocky Horror Picture Show as Alex rips through this sci fi classic. The accuracy of the imitations and uncanny inflection of the lines might surprise you.

name: Fallout: A History
description: Join self-admitted Fallout Obsessive: Chiki Cosplay and the FanDames Initiative in a journey to learn the history and lore of the Fallout Universe through fun, interactive games! From the Vault Dweller to the Sole Survivor and whoever you decide to be in Fallout 76 this panel will cover it all.

name: SNK 40th Anniversary
description: SNK 40th Anniversary Collection creative director Frank Cifaldi spills his guts on what it took to preserve SNK's heritage. Come hear some behind-the-scenes stories, see gameplay from some really weird old games, and check out some rare old SNK ephemera!

name: Stand-up Comedy Writing Workshop
description:
Oh, you think you're funny, do you?  Come learn the hows, whys, and wherefores of writing a joke and performing it live with seasoned convention comedians +2 Comedy!  

Bring a pen and something to write on!

name: Spaceship Bridge Simulation
description: Spaceship Bridge Simulator is a multiplayer co-operative spaceship simulation game

name: Spaceship Bridge Simulation
description: Starship Bridge Simulation up to 6 players

name: From Crunch to Unions: Labor Issues in Games
description: In the wake of the controversy surrounding working conditions at Rockstar Games, Game Workers Unite will be presenting a educational panel about labor issues in the game industry. We will be covering a wide variety of topics, from crunch to layoffs, with additional focus given to issues faced by students and indie developers.

name: Audioshield Tournament
description: Think you have the best rhythm and hottest moves? Join us for an Audioshield tournament and show us what you got!

name: brentalfloss
description: Brent "brentalfloss" Black is a comedian, musician, and gamer. His YouTube channel first gained notoriety in 2008 when he added lyrics to the title theme from Mega Man 3 and created the "With Lyrics". He has since grown a YouTube subscriber base of over 300,000 and released three full-length albums, all which have reached the top ten in the iTunes comedy charts, and two of which reached the top ten on Billboard's comedy charts. He lives in New York City and performs at music venues and gaming conventions in the USA, Canada, and the UK.

name: Wave Race 64 (N64)
description:
Consoles Tournament

Register for this tournament at the Ops Table in the Consoles game room. Please return to Ops at least 15 minutes before scheduled start of tournament.

name: Nidhogg 2 Tournament
description: Come play Nidhogg 2 in the LAN Theatre!

name: Running Your First Role-Playing Game
description: You've got some books, you've got some dice, you've got an idea for a great RPG.  But what next?  How do you organize your adventure?  What kind of NPCs will you need?  What do you do when the players do something unexpected?  In short - what do you need to know for your first time running a role-playing game?  Captain Mike goes through the experience from brainstorming the idea to closing the final curtain.

name: MusIQ From The Heart Showcase (LIVE MUSIC)
description:
5:00 PM: Jackson Parodi
5:45 PM: BitForce
6:30 PM: Kadesh Flow
7:15 PM: Substantial
8:00 PM: InsaneInTheRainMusic with Super Soul Bros.
9:00 PM: EyeQ with special guest Kristofer Maddigan (Composer for Cuphead), Doug Perry, Anthony Dickinson and Super Soul Bros.

name: Demoscene Effects Basics
description: A presentation panel on history, categorization and some basic ideas/math behind the effects. Presenter: Jakub “Argasek” Argasinski

name: From the Vault: A History of Video Games in 10 Objects
description:
In this talk and discussion, video game historian Carly Kocurek will present 10 evocative video game-related objects from notable archives, including those at the Strong Museum of Play and the Learning Games Initiative. By discussing the artifacts' historical significance, Kocurek walks audience members through the practices professional historians use to study games and demonstrate the importance of preserving video games in institutions. Highlighted items will include the arcade game Centipede, the metal runes packaged with Ultima Underworld, an original U.S. release Tamagotchi, and Purple Moon branded figurines, among others.

Panelist:
Carly A. Kocurek is the author of two books about the history of video games: Coin-Operated Americans: Rebooting Boyhood at the Video Game Arcade (University of Minnesota Press, 2015) and Brenda Laurel: Pioneering Games for Girls (Bloomsbury, 2017). With Jennifer deWinter, she cofounded and co-edits the Influential Video Game Designers book series for Bloomsbury. She is an associate professor of digital humanities and media studies at the Illinois Institute of Technology in Chicago, and she is currently co-authoring a book on the Ultima game franchise.

name: Buckaroo Banzai, Across The MAG Dimension
description: The influence of the 1984 film The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across The 8th Dimension has  permeated popular culture for decades, with countless references in a number of successful film franchises, including Star Trek and Back To The Future. The world created by Earl Mac Rauch and W.D. Richter lived on in comics and a 1984 video game for Commodore, Atari and other platforms. Yet the originally planned Banzai film universe died with the first movie. What makes this weird little film so influential? Where might it have gone if allowed to continue? We’ll show some clips of film references to BB, the comics and games and discuss the film and it’s lore from different viewpoints.

name: The Single Greatest Gaming World Ever Created!
description: Each panelist brings their own definition of the single greatest gaming world ever created and then defends their statement from the audience and the other panelists.

name: Everything You Love is Bad For You
description: Every day we're inundated with news and tweets and blog posts telling us that the tech we love is not just bad for us, but likely bringing about the end of civilization as we know it. Today it's video games and screen time and tomorrow it will likely be VR and holodecks. This kind of social and moral panic is an ancient human tradition and this panel will dive into over 2,000 years of the Abe Simpson Cycle - "I used to be with ‘it’, but then they changed what ‘it’ was. Now what I’m with isn’t ‘it’ anymore and what’s ‘it’ seems weird and scary."

name: Music Theory 101
description: Video game music is a hugely important part to many of our lives. It has underscored some of our fondest memories from childhood, from hearing the credits theme to Super Mario World as you beat it for the first time, or perhaps being terrified by Sephiroth’s battle theme “One Winged Angel” from Final Fantasy VII. Underneath the surface of these great pieces of music lie simple notes and rhythms which all work together to create the soundtrack of our memories. Video game musicians FamilyJules, insaneintherainmusic, Sab Irene & 8BitMusicTheory present a live video game music theory session, where we’ll dive deep into some fan-favorite video game tunes and explain exactly what makes them so great & memorable from a theoretical standpoint. No music theory experience required, we’ll make things simple as possible for you!

name: Creating Spaces: A Primer on Reverberation and other time based signal processing.
description: Time based signal processing like reverberation is used by the mixing engineer to create or enhance space around elements in a mix.  In this lecture Dr. Cresci will discuss the origins of time based signal processing, standard plugin concepts,  and various usage techniques.  By the end of the lecture you will be able to move beyond the presets and bend any reverberation plugin to your will.

description: Qualifying rounds for Pinball Tournament

Come out and play Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition.  This year D&D Adventurers League features adventurers in Waterdeep: the city of Splendors!  A grand urban caper awaits you. Pit your skill and bravado against villains the likes of which you’ve never faced before, and let the dragon hunt begin! 
 Adventure all weekend long, no experience required and all materials provided.  Walk up events feature 2 and 4 hour sessions.  For more action check out the sign up events that feature 4+ hour sessions of D&D adventure!

name: Shodo: Japanese Calligraphy
description: Take a break from the stresses of the convention outside and pull up a chair, as we channel our inner Amaterasu from Ookami. We'll be learning the basics of the art of Japanese calligraphy (and a little bit of ukiyo-e , or ink painting, as well) as we practice our brushstrokes and even mixing ink by hand. A small fee is required to cover the cost of ink and paper.

name: Robotic Knife Fight Tournament Exhibition
description: Ever wanted to fight robots?  Well this is your chance to live the dream.  Participants will be driving 18 inch square VEX Clawbots with pins on the graspers and balloons on the rear of their bot.  Last robot with an inflated balloon wins.

name: Band Merch sales
description: Hours of Operations

name: The Hit Points
description: The Hit Points are Matt Menefee & Eli Bishop, an acoustic video game cover band from Nashville, TN. They blend the string band sounds of Appalachia with the digital & symphonic compositions of video games like Street Fighter 2, Pokémon, and the Final Fantasy series. Born out of Matt and Eli's enthusiasm and deep respect for international composers from Yasunori Mitsuda to Jeremy Soule, the music of The Hit Points is for the dorm room gamer as much as the front porch picker.

name: Open and Guided Jams
description:
Bring your instrument (or try our in-house gear), grab a microphone, and get ready to jam with our highly-talented staff and guests! Or just swing by and enjoy the live music! Not sure where to start, or want to brush up on your chops? We have workshops scheduled throughout the weekend for all skill levels.

Note: time ranges for Open and Guided Jams may vary slightly due to scheduled events in the Jam Clinic and Jam Shop.

~~~

The Jam Clinic is a musician-to-musician education venue at the Music and Gaming Festival (MAGFest), dedicated to co-mentoring participants on how to play and improvise within genres such as jazz fusion, funk, and rock, as well as popular video game music.

We strive to teach participants and empower them with the language of musical communication, while embracing a leadership-centered, technology-powered, challenging, and fun atmosphere for our visitors.

name: Paizo Organized Play in 2019
description: Come talk to Paizo organized play manager Tonya Woldridge about what the future holds for Pathfinder Society with the release of the new version of Pathfinder RPG, as well as upcoming plans for Starfinder Society.

name: Filling in the Banks: Populating the World of Your RPG
description:
You've done the hard part:  You've gathered 4-7 adults together at a specific time and place for an agreed upon regular basis to play pretend and roll some dice.
But how do you fill their world with things to explore and enjoy?  Join longtime players and game masters Corey Fish and Jordan Olsen as they provide you with tips and tricks on filling the world of your rpg with NPCs, set pieces and more.

name: Puzzle Fighter
description: Signups are available at https://reggie.magfest.org/attractions/arcade-tournaments or the kiosk at the arcade help desk. name: Antipode Presents: Super Mario Bellydance World 2
description:
t’s a me, Antipode! Blue shells and banana peels, Bowser has 1-UP’d Mario again and Princess Peach is nowhere to be found! Feel free to laugh and cheer during this comedic dance show as Mario searches for his princess in yet another castle. See if he is able to cross the finish line, or TOADally misses the mark! Plumbers, koopalings, and gamers are all welcomed to this all ages show!

Fusing the theatrics of acting with a mix of cosplay, pop-culture, and off-beat humor Antipode brings the audience not just dance, but full geek entertainment.

name: Soul Calibur 5 (Xbox 360)
description:
Consoles Tournament

Register for this tournament at the Ops Table in the Consoles game room. Please return to Ops at least 15 minutes before scheduled start of tournament.

name: Warcraft 3 Tournament
description: The Warcraft 3 Tournament has returned, this time on our brand new stage!

name: Boy Wonder(swan): The Lasting Impact of Gunpei Yokoi
description:
Two decades after his death, the philosophies of legendary designer Gunpei Yokoi are still seen throughout the game industry. You might know him by his creations -- the Game & Watch, the Game Boy, the Wonderswan -- but just how much of modern day gaming do we owe to Yokoi’s ideas? This panel will take you through the past, present, and future of gaming through the lens of the life of Gunpei Yokoi.

Panelist:
Kelsey Lewin creates mini-documentaries about odd and obscure topics from video game history on Youtube. She is also the co-owner of Seattle-based video game retailer Pink Gorilla Games, and is involved with various projects at the Video Game History Foundation.

name: Buddhist Philosophy and Enlightenment Themes in the Animated Donkey Kong Television Show
description: The Donkey Kong Animated series is actually a masterpiece that many people miss. Join me as we compare concepts and stories within Eastern Philosophy with the trials that Donkey Kong faces to better understand them, and perhaps reach a little bit of enlightenment of our own.

name: Revenge of the Lawyers: The Obligatory Legal Panel
description: The video game lawyers return once again to discuss a host of legal issues that affect the game industry.  If you have a question about the law, then come get a life-changing* answer from this panel of legal professionals.  (*Changes not guaranteed to be for the better.)

name: Environmental Storytelling: How I Learned to Write through Playing Video Games
description: The popular saying goes: “A picture’s worth a thousand words.” With the rapid developments in technology, our storytelling is changing to not just be on the page, but through movies, television, and video games--highly visual mediums. Through the power of images, we can convey a whole narrative in a short space. Games like Deus Ex: Mankind Divided and Gone Home use environmental storytelling to give us pieces of characters’ lives. In this workshop, we’ll discuss examples of games that tell stories through objects, and go into our own writing exercises inspired by video games.

name: Kawaii Bass
description:
7:00 pm- 7:30 pm Epikuro
7:30 pm- 8:00 pm Raziki Slice
8:00 pm- 8:30 pm Fibre
8:30 pm- 9:00 pm Pan!c Pop
9:00 pm- 9:30 pm D41N
9:30 pm- 10:00 pm Sixtroke

name: Crossplay Crash Course: Break Your Cosplay Barriers!
description:
Looking to cosplay that magical girl or that beefy boy you've admired but have thought to yourself, "I could never pull that off..." Stop on by and learn some helpful tricks that will guide you to finding that extra push you've needed so that you can stop pushing away the idea of cosplaying the characters you love! 

We will discuss makeup, posing, and light body modification to help anybody cosplay that character they admire! Silver Sheep and Risuruuu have years of experience cosplaying characters outside their "comfort zones" and want to help you do that too! Maybe you'll even get to hear some funny stories straight from the con-floor ;)

name: Punk'd Up
description: Cyberpunk.  Steampunk.  Diselpunk.  Gothic-punk.  So many variations on the classical punk archetype.  Looking at the World of Darkness tabletop games, the Ministry of Peculiar Occurrences novels, and games like Cyberpunk 2077, one wonders what these sub-genres are and where did they come from?  Join this exploration of the engimatic subculture that has endured and evolved over the years and how it continues to influence our culture and our art to this day.

name: We're Video Game Lawyers, Ask Us Anything
description: Video game and entertainment lawyers sit down to discuss and answer questions about the various issues facing musicians, game developers, and content creators as the industry continues to grow.

name: Demoshow: Part 1
description: Presentation of the best demoscene productions chosen by the organizers of the event, shown on screen.

name: Gamer Symphony Orchestra @UMD: Bringing Video Game Music to the Symphony Hall
description:
The student-run Gamer Symphony Orchestra at the University of Maryland is the first collegiate ensemble exclusively devoted to performing orchestral arrangements of video game music and using that music as an educational tool. We now boast a roster of more than 120 musicians, including 30 singers, and play to packed houses at the University of Maryland's largest performing arts venue, the 1,100-seat Dekelboum Concert Hall. Our mission is to bridge the worlds of video games and the performing arts and promote orchestral VGM as an art form.
 This panel will include five of our GSO officers representing a diverse array of roles and experiences within the orchestra. We will first discuss the history, vision, and operations of the group. We will then close with a Q&A session with our officers

description: Signups are available at https://reggie.magfest.org/attractions/arcade-tournaments or the kiosk at the arcade help desk. Please arrive 10 minutes before the scheduled start time for check-in. YOU MUST CHECK IN BEFORE THE TOURNAMENT BEGINS OR YOU WILL BE REMOVED FROM THE PARTICIPANT LIST.

name: Triforce Quartet
description: The Triforce Quartet began innocently as a short Zelda medley for an encore of a recital in early 2007, but the video of using traditional string quartet instruments to play music of classic games gained viral popularity later that summer. Thanks to this, cellist Chad Schwartz was able to combine his love for video games, along with years of classical training, to arrange a variety of video game themes that even non-gamers can enjoy. The four members of the Triforce Quartet take audience members on an unforgettable musical journey.

name: Open Mic
description: Chiptune Open Mic

name: Oozumou 64 (N64)
description:
Consoles Tournament

Part 1 of the Trashy Triple Crown!

Register for this tournament at the Ops Table in the Consoles game room. Please return to Ops at least 15 minutes before scheduled start of tournament.

name: F-Zero GX (GameCube)
description:
Consoles Tournament

Register for this tournament at the Ops Table in the Consoles game room. Please return to Ops at least 15 minutes before scheduled start of tournament.

name: Super Smash Bros. Brawl (Wii)
description:
Please show up 10 mins in advance to the Ops desk in the Smash Zone.

Tournaments are limited to 32 people and may last longer than an hour.

name: Introduction to Music Recording and Production
description: Are you a musician who wants to get into music recording or production, but doesn't know how or where to start? This is the workshop for you! We'll cover basic terminology and workflow practices, as well as starting points for both software and hardware. Basic familiarity with music concepts will be required, but no prior recording or production experience is necessary.

name: OpenTTD Tournament
description: Manage your transport company in this 24-hour tournament for the open source transportation game.  As this runs a full day, BYOC is heavily recommended.

name: Vampire: The Masquerade:
description:
Kick Magfest off right by participating in our 8th annual Vampire the Masquerade Larp. The Prince of National Harbor is holding her yearly court, and like always trouble is brewing. 

Character creation will begin at 8 with game starting between 8:30 and 9.

name: Cosplay 201: Light It Up
description: Intermediate-level electronics fun, with a focus on safely soldering strings of shine (say that thrice fast)! Join cosplayer divisionten as we learn how to make are cosplays glow and sparkle, from simple single LED to daisy-chianing and custom programming a full rig. Wether you've never touched a soldering iron before or you're ready to delve into some Arduino programming, we'll have something new for you!

name: Fat Gatsby Grudge Match: Castlevania
description: Join the FatGatsby.com podcast crew as we put 16 Castlevania games into a bracket and fight it out over which is the best Castlevania game of all time

name: Rare Game Mechanics
description: Some game mechanics are common. Drafting cards. Rolling dice. Choosing actions. Worker placement. They are used in many games for a variety of reasons. But what about the weird ones? Ever play a game with a Rondel? Experience the glory of a "Promise Cube?" Wait until we talk about what can only be described as "Bohnanza Hand!" Join the GeekNights crew for a deep exploration of the rarely used (sometimes for a reason) mechanics of tabletop games.

name: Dominion Tournament w/ Random Expansions
description: Come on down to play Dominion! This is a more casual tournament, and as such random expansions will be used for each individual table.

name: Catan Tournament w/ Random Expansions
description: Come on down and play Catan! This is a more casual tournament, and as such each table will be provided with a random expansion!

name: Yoga for Gamers
description: Reflect, restore, and reboot your personal "system"-- your body-mind-breath complex. Join me in an all-welcome, all-levels meditation and movement practice, accompanied by gaming themes and music for inspiration. This isn't about "exercising"; it's about connecting the circuits within yourself, and observing the nature of the mind as it renders your personal gameworld. Self-awareness = Choice. Choose your adventure.

name: The Making of a Therapeutic RPG
description: What if there were a system for TRPGs based around social and emotional attributes like emotional integrity, instead of strength and dexterity? This question was the catalyst for iThrive to develop the Critical Strengths Engine, a pen and paper RPG ruleset for exploring and supporting social and emotional skill development. Although created to be accessible and enjoyable for all, the CSE was designed with and for the needs of mental health professionals in mind. This panel will cover our collaborative design process, lessons learned in development and during play testing, and what our next steps and future goals look like.

name: Collegiate Esports: How to Get Involved at Both the Varsity and Club Level
description: Everyone knows that a team needs players and a coach, but there are a lot of people behind the scenes as well. With the rise of collegiate esports at both the varsity and student organization level, there are many ways to get involved. If you are looking to play for a team, be an analyst, be a tournament organizer, be your club's main shoutcaster, or anything else, we will help you get started.

name: Real talk on Streaming as a hobby or career
description: A lot of people think Streaming is easy, you just turn on the console, PC a cam and go! We'll have a real talk convo on what actually goes into streaming whether or not you consider it a serious hobby or want to make a career out of it.

name: Subliminal Nostalgic Cues in Banjo Kazooie Nuts & Bolts: A Technical Analysi
description: The Nintendo 64 Banjo Kazooie games notably have clear and unique atmospheres, which are largely attributed to the quirky, memorable music composed by Grant Kirkhope. Eight years after the release of Banjo Tooie, the series was rebirthed by Banjo Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts. Although vastly different in gameplay, Nuts & Bolts includes countless references to the original games, including the fabled Stop-n-Swop eggs. The game distinctly targets players sense of nostalgia for the original games, and this is particularly evident in the music. Through musical analysis of various tunes, we will explore how these feelings of nostalgia are evoked.

name: Video Games You've Never Heard of
description: From Kuso, to Japanese only releases to obscure oddities, the object of this panel is to showcase games you've never heard of! Some are awesome, some are terrible, some are just plain ... weird. With live demos and audience participation, expect to be surprised as we hopefully stump your game knowledge with these obscure titles!

name: Overcoming Shyness and Making Friends
description: If the thought of talking to strangers makes you uncomfortable, but you really want to make new friends at MAGFest, this is the event for you! We'll go over tips on meeting new people and having conversations, and then we'll practice them together in a safe space. (Participation is encouraged, but if you aren't comfortable talking to strangers but still want to learn something new, you're welcome to come and listen!) It's the Beginner's Hall/tutorial level of friend-making at MAG. After discussing the basics, we'll take time to address more complicated social situations and challenges, so bring your questions. By the end of the panel, you'll be equipped to continue practicing your new skills with other attendees for the rest of MAGFest! Join our adventuring party and let's make friends.

name: Give Em The Boot: A Punk Rock Primer
description: Punk is a fluid, every evolving genre of music (but don't say that out loud or risk being called "totally not punk). From origins in the 60s through the skate, pop, crust, horror, and emo booms of subsequent decades, the ethos and mindsets might have changed, but the music has managed to remain culturally relevant and indeed popular. This panel (tries its best to) explore the origins of the genre, the landmark bands and movements, the ages of its existence, and the ambiguity of its future. It also presents a rocking good time, or at least it tries to.

name: Twinkle Star Sprites
description:
A Neo Geo World Tour event!

Signups are available at https://smash.gg/tournament/neo-geo-world-tour-2-washington-dc-stop or the kiosk at the arcade help desk. Please arrive 10 minutes before the scheduled start time for check-in. YOU MUST CHECK IN BEFORE THE TOURNAMENT BEGINS OR YOU WILL BE REMOVED FROM THE PARTICIPANT LIST.

description: Come hang out in the LAN Theatre and play some Jackbox!

name: VGM in the Music Industry
description:
This will be a question & answer panel focusing on the industry side of video game music - what avenues there are for musicians to create/cover video game music, how distributing music works if you're a VGM artist, how a VGM label works, copyright/licensing issues, career paths, etc...

Panel will include:

- Pony (Brand Manager, Soundrop)
- Rebecca (Talent Coordinator, Soundrop)
- Rusty (Product Manager, Soundrop)
- Jesse (Licensing Expert, Loudr)
- Sebastian (Founder & CEO, Materia Collective)

name: Armour Academy: Scale Armour!
description:
Since the dawn of time, scale armor has been the coolest of all the armors. In this panel, we will teach the basic art of scale mail weaving, and send you home with a small piece of scale armor forged by your own hands.
There will be a fifteen dollar materials fee to participate in this panel, but any may observe for free.

name: Dropmix 101: Learn about the game that joins music and tabletop gaming
description: Get a chance to see, and play a tabletop game that can DJ a party. Dropmix via an app, and RFID playing cards allows users to play various tabletop games while ALSO creating music, featuring artists like Sia, Skrillex, The Black Eyed Peas, Hall & Oats and many others. If you want to get a chance to see, and play this truly unique game, this is a great place to start.

Please arrive 10 minutes before the scheduled start time for check-in. YOU MUST CHECK IN BEFORE THE TOURNAMENT BEGINS OR YOU WILL BE REMOVED FROM THE PARTICIPANT LIST.

name: Mario Maker Madness: Co-Op Mode
description:
Mario Maker Madness returns for another Magfest! Audience members will attempt to complete original Mario Maker levels, but this year you will play with a partner in a variety of cooperative challenges. Sign up with a friend or be matched with another audience member in levels that will put your teamwork skills to the test!

Any audience member can participate. All skill levels welcome and encouraged!

name: D-Pad presents Deceitful Dungeon Delve
description: An RPG maker game made into a gameshow where contestants delve into a dungeon where all monsters are defeated by questions and can gain items and equipment to help against the increasingly hard questions.

name: Video Games & Hip Hop: How The Link Between the Two Is Stronger Than You Might Think, and Why That Matters
description:
Hip Hop and Video Games took root at similar points in US history, and while they have taken over the globe in different ways, their trajectories are highly similar. 

Members of The Nerdy People Collective and Guests will discuss why this similarity in trajectory is important, why this matters to both art mediums, and why this of paramount importance to both the perceptions and acceptance of marginalized groups in geek spaces.

name: How to Live Stream 101
description: Ever wonder what you need to do to live stream to the masses on Twitch? Have McLaffyTaffy, Librizzi and MyLawyerFriend tell you the ins and outs on how to stream effectively.

name: Mega Man X - Wrong Run
description:
Join Slappymeats as he plays through Mega Man X with the wrong boss order!

10:00PM - 11:30PM

name: Pro Wrestling Fan Connection for Marginalized Genders / Sexes
description: Centering women, LGBTQ+, gender minority,  and other marginalized voices in the professional wrestling fandom, this panel will cover a variety of topics and issues that affect those in the professional wrestling community, from their perspective. If you've ever felt uncomfortable or alone at a wrestling panel before, this one's for you. Come to contribute, simply observe, or find new wrestling companions to go to your next show with!

name: Lounging with LAN
description: End the start of Magfest by lounging around with the LAN staff and talk about whatever we feel like.  There might be games (played badly).

name: Practical Music Theory for Jam Sessions with 8-bit Music Theory
description: All too often music theory is thought of something to be done in the classroom, something that we apply retroactively to music that's already been made. Not my philosophy! In this workshop I go over some different ways to analyze lead sheets on the fly, and give some yummy music theory morsels that you can actually use in the moment!

name: Beyond D&D: Tabletop Treasures
description: Like D&D? But wait, there’s more! This is an overview of systems OTHER than the famous D20 system for your tabletop enjoyment.

name: MAGES Microtalks: Games Research in Five Minutes or Less
description: Games academics from across disciplines present their work in 5 minutes or less in a variety of formats. Whether it's full-on Ph.D. work or a journal article idea they're kicking around, this microtalk panel is a great way to learn about different hot topics in games research in record time!

name: +2 Comedy Presents Game the Gamer
description: Four Contestants.  Three video games.  One prize.  Sounds straightforward, right?  But when cheating is encouraged and sabotage is in the rules, the tables can turn at any minute.  Be a part of the fun before the Official YouTube launch.

name: What the heck is Eurovision?
description: Bored of your typical American music television shows where its just singing cover songs? Want exciting staging, campy lyrics and ridiculous outfits? It's time to experience Eurovision, one of the largest music productions on the planet. We'll look at some of the best (and worst) performances ever, as well as some famous names and songs you might never know competed!

name: Achieving Financial Independence Through Game Audio & VGM
description:
The topic is about game audio and VGM as a viable career.
The panel aims to inspire would be game audio people, whether they be a musician, producer, content creator or a bit of everything that yes, their chosen career path can lead them to financially support themselves.

The four chosen panelists are a nice sampling of creatives from varied game audio backgrounds. Sound designer, composer, remixer, and YouTube VGM artist, and a bit of a combo of everything. But also support themselves with mostly income from game audio.

name: Diamonds in the Rough: Classic Indie RPGs You Should Play
description:
With the wide and rapid accessibility of game-making tools and the rise of indie developers, the number of games made with tools like RPG Maker on Steam and other publishing tools number in the thousands.

Let's take a trip down memory lane to see some of the great games from the early days of RPG making including A Blurred Line, The Way, Velsarbor, and more!

name: Mega Man 2 with Takashi Tateishi
description:
Matt Papa plays through the game while the composer of Mega Man 2, Takashi Tateishi joins him on the couch!

11:40 to 1:40AM

name: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate (Switch)
description:
Please show up 10 mins in advance to the Ops desk in the Smash Zone.

Tournaments are limited to 32 people and may last longer than an hour.

name: Swingin' In Space with The Koopa Kids
Persona: 20 Years of the Velvet Room
description: The Persona game series has had a substantial (and not sequential) history in the US. Come enjoy an overview of the game series that takes psychology, symbolism, and social commentary to new heights - mainline numbered games as well as spin-off games- as well as placing it in context of the parent franchise of Shin Megami Tensei.

name: Understanding Compressors, Expanders and Gates.  Altering Dynamics in Audio Recordings
description: We will discuss the basics of dynamic processing in audio, beginning with the fundamentals of gain curve manipulation and then discussing the history of various audio compression and expansion techniques.  We will discuss the role of dynamic processing in recording, mixing and mastering,  touching on the loudness wars of the early 2000s.  Finally, we will address the constraints of various audio compression algorithms and physical media such as cassettes and vinyl.

name: The Staffers Are Dead
description:
The staffers have died, and now they are spoOoOoOkY ghOoOosts!!!!! One of the ghosts knows who killed them, and is sending messages from the other side to indicate the true identity of the killer. The other two will lead teams of audience
members in a quest to identify the culprit. (Learn to play Mysterium, a picture association game. Expansions may also be used.)

name: Swingin' in Space with Kris Maddigan of Cuphead and ConSoul
Craziest Japanese Commercials
description: What does Gundam ointment, pasta aliens, and a ramen fueled car chase has in common? They are part of an hour of curated, crazy commercials from Japan!

name: The Haunted Mansion, a silent fandom
description: In honor of the upcoming 50th anniversary of the Haunted Mansion at Disney parks, I will discuss the ride's history. Why its become so popular but overlooked. Topics include lore, the movie, and videogame version. There will be video, audio clips and visuals.

name: The Blue Bomber VS The Blue Blur: Who Has the Craziest Expanded Universe
description: The Blue Bomber Versus The Blue Blur: Who Has the Most Outlandish Expanded Universe. Join RobotBoombox and the Retro Action Squad as we look at the most ridiculous things from our favorite boys in blue.

name: Youtube Poop and Internet Remix Culture
description: Join the YTP Movement as we all come together to share how this bizarre internet video genre has helped us with our current skills and careers! We'll be showing how our content has evolved the past 10 years and how it's influenced humor and editing styles to this day. We'll also end it off with a Q&A and a potential viewing party! Panel moderated by Eamon Mcardle

name: Japanese Pro Wrestling Primer
description: New Japan Pro Wrestling has been taken the wrestling world by storm in recent years but the culture and history of professional wrestling in Japan extends much further. Come learn about the many other active promotions in Japan in this panel for old and new pro wrestling fans alike!

name: Mega Man 10
description:
Epic James of EpicGameMusic plays through Mega Man 10!

1:30 - 3:00AM

name: MITS Closes
description:
MITS Closes for the night at 4am.

Come back tomorrow at 10am!

description:
We've watched TheSkipper1995 grow from a sweet baby to a Mega Man destroying man. And we're going to throw him to the wolves by playing one of the hardest fan made Mega Man games. Blindfolded.

3:10 - 4:10 AM

name: Mega Man V (GameBoy)
description:
Mega Man was on the GameBoy. Not all of them are very good though. Mega Man V is the best one. So TheSkipper1995 is going to play it real good.

5:30 - 8:30 AM

Roll One Out
description: A panel devoted to the complexities of character creation across many systems. The fun, the diversity, the challenge of making the perfect avatar to embody through the imaginary life!

Kazooaloo plays the last Mega Man X game Capcom put out there!

8:40 - 10:40 AM

name: Pinball Tournament Qualifiers
description: Qualifying rounds for Pinball Tournament

name: Make an ugly doll (beginner sewing class)
description: Come learn how to make your own custom stuffy. Beginner sewing class for hand stitching and design. Lecture is free, supplies $5. First come, first serve.

name: Gaming in the Library
description: From tabletop to console, gaming can be an expensive hobby. Don't break the bank to supply your addiction! Learn how to advocate for gaming collections in your local library and let your tax dollars work for you.

name: Make Your First Roll 20 Macro (DND 5e)
description: The community created character sheet for DND 5e on Roll 20 is great! But sometimes you just want to put your own spin on things. Enter macros! Bring your laptop to this workshop, and leave with your first custom macro.

name: The Weirdest Arcade Fighting Games You Never Played
description: Remember when fighting games were all over the arcades? Odds are you remember the likes of Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat, but what about some of the other fighting games that tried to make their mark during this time? Heidi Kemps and Matt Hall will take you on a whirlwind tour of some of the strangest brawlers that debuted during this period of time, and showcase the bizarre ideas and gimmicks they implemented to try and stand out from the crowd. The best part is that we’ll be inviting audience members to test their might at these arcade oddities! Can you throw down with Jackie Chan, break the Vicious Circle, and beat the General? Come to the panel if you’re looking for an ass beating!

name: Gamer Fitness
description: Break the stereotype of lazy gamer and join our group exercise and discussion session about staying healthy while maintaining your regular gaming habits. BE PREPARED TO MOVE AND EXERCISE!

name: Armored Core 3: Silent Line (PS2)
description:
Consoles Tournament 

Please arrive at Consoles Op 15 minutes before start of tournament.

name: King of Fighters 2000 (PS2)
description:
Consoles Tournament 

Please arrive at Consoles Op 15 minutes before start of tournament.

name: Dungeons and Dragons Adventurers League
description:
Come out and play Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition.  This year D&D Adventurers League features adventurers in Waterdeep: the city of Splendors!  A grand urban caper awaits you. Pit your skill and bravado against villains the likes of which you’ve never faced before, and let the dragon hunt begin! 
 Adventure all weekend long, no experience required and all materials provided.  Walk up events feature 2 and 4 hour sessions.  For more action check out the sign up events that feature 4+ hour sessions of D&D adventure!

https://reggie.magfest.org/attractions/

name: Return of the Chuck Levin's Keyboard and Synthesizer (and Electronic Percussion) Petting Zoo!
description:
After a highly-successful trial run at MAGLabs 2018, renowned local musical instrument retailer Chuck Levin's Washington Music Center comes to Super MAGFest 2019 with a curated selection of the newest, most powerful stage pianos, music production keyboards, analog synthesizers, and electronic percussion systems available today—all for you to get your hands on and try out!

No prior experience with keyboards or drums is necessary—just a sense of imagination and curiosity! Turn knobs, flip switches, press keys, strike pads, and experience sonic landscapes of your own making. Questions or comments? Staff from Chuck Levin's will be available to assist attendees, demonstrate cool features, and help you discover ways to create new sounds.

name: Open and Guided Jams
description:
Bring your instrument (or try our in-house gear), grab a microphone, and get ready to jam with our highly-talented staff and guests! Or just swing by and enjoy the live music! Not sure where to start, or want to brush up on your chops? We have workshops scheduled throughout the weekend for all skill levels.

Note: time ranges for Open and Guided Jams may vary slightly due to scheduled events in the Jam Clinic and Jam Shop.

~~~

The Jam Clinic is a musician-to-musician education venue at the Music and Gaming Festival (MAGFest), dedicated to co-mentoring participants on how to play and improvise within genres such as jazz fusion, funk, and rock, as well as popular video game music.

We strive to teach participants and empower them with the language of musical communication, while embracing a leadership-centered, technology-powered, challenging, and fun atmosphere for our visitors.

name: Open Jam
description: Jamspace Open Jam: Peach

name: Morning FreeForm Larps
description:
FreeForm Larps: 
 Damocles Thread Development presents a selection FreeForm Larps. Free Form gaming is a very different experience for people who have never tried it before. The games will push people to become emotionally attached to their characters and deal with situations realistically. Come by and try something new with our FreeForm Larps. The selection available will vary each morning but may include.

Wight Wedding: A freeform LARP about a wedding like any other -- except half the guests are dead, and some have unfinished business. This is a comedy game with some horror and tragedy elements. 

Sins of the Father: A multigenerational hell. The Barbatos family has a deep dark secret, and it's not the embezzling, the murders, the incest, or the rampant narcissism. Each generation, the cousins gather to decide which of them will sell their soul for the good of the family. It isn’t just figurative language about the evils of money perverting the souls of those who do what it takes to make it. No, the Barbatos family is in bed with the Devil in the most literal of ways.  

The Porch: It’s the last day of summer before you head off to your freshman year of college, or the military, or just back to your shitty job at the gas station. You’re hanging out with all your small-town high school friends. Each one of you has a burning question you can’t ask

Shattered Hero: The greatest hero of the world has fallen, and now all that’s left are her friends to try and pick up the pieces. Play as the companions as they enter the mind of their fallen comrade and rebuild her mind, but are they rebuilding her, or who they thought she was?

name: Engaging Fandoms: Crafting Stories for an Established Audience
description: Fan fic writers rejoice! A few of the creatives behind Super Smash Opera and Evenings in Quarantine: The Zombie Opera are here to share their thoughts on parodies and derivative works. We tackle sticky topics including how to work with established characters, how to hold your audience’s attention, setting a tone, and listening to feedback. Fun insights for all kinds of creators and fans alike.

name: Testbeds for Future Tech: Applying HCI Frameworks to Game Worlds
description: Video games provide immersive spaces where players can experience technologies through digital agents and use these technologies to achieve game-defined goals in designed user contexts while exploring an interactive environment. Technologists can design and build demos while players test them. Game worlds allow us to explore design considerations for all kinds of tech, from augmented reality to wearables. What we learn from applying human-computer interaction concepts to fictitious game tech can be applied to real-world examples. This panel will explore how games can serve as effective use cases for future technologies and will draw parallels with existing technology.

name: Beyond Reality: An Exploration of the Past and Future of VR
description: With origins in the 1800's, VR has had a long road to get where it is today. This session will present an overview on the history of VR technologies and discuss the potential impact that new breakthroughs could have on...

name: Video Game Clubs and America
description: Start a high school Video Game Club today and empower the socially awkward to be socially active through gaming and camaraderie.  The impact you can have a child in today’s world through gaming is unbelievable.  Learn how to breakdown stereotypes, empower the next generation, and help to define a more positive view of gaming and game culture.  Through social outreach citizenship video game clubs, we will rewrite the world’s understandings and expectations of gamers. Weird, cool, fat or skinny, in a VGC world no one needs to eat lunch alone.

name: Museum of Science Fiction Presents: The Technology of the Fallout Series
description: The Museum of Science Fiction will be going over the technology of the Fallout universe and how it relates to, but is also different from, the real world.

name: Spaceship Bridge Simulation
description: Spaceship Bridge Simulation up to 6 players

name: Spaceship Bridge Simulation
description: Spaceship Bridge Simulation up to 6 players

name: MITS Opens
description:
Come play and see games made by indie developers in various stages of development from playable prototype to complete project!

MITS will close again at 4am.

name: 7 Wonders Tournament
description: Come on down and play 7 Wonders! This is the original game, and not 7 Wonders Duel

name: King Of Tokyo Tournament
description: Come on down and play Kings of Tokyo!

name: Where Have All the Heroes Gone? A Conversation on Video Game Heroes
description: In a world of ethical choice, who can save us from our self-destructive tendencies? Open worlds, ambiguous goals, and apathetic NPCs seem to fill the video game landscape making it hard to fulfill a traditional heroic role. This panel seeks to answer the questions: What makes a hero? What is an anti-hero? What qualities define a heroic action? Who are the greatest video game character heroes of all time? How can we design new video game characters that encourage players to feel like they are a hero?

name: Imposter Syndrome, Dunning-Kruger, and You
description: Doubt is part of the creative process, but how much doubt is too much? If you tend to minimize or ignore your accomplishments or catch yourself feeling like a fraud despite your experience or expertise, you may be struggling with Imposter Syndrome. The goal of this discussion is to create a space for sharing stories related to past or present struggles with self-doubt, swapping strategies for pushing through feeling like a fraud, and a bit of science to give you the edge the next time you and Imposter Syndrome go toe to toe.

name: How to Make Gameboy Chiptune
description: We'll discuss various methods for creating music with the Nintendo Gameboy line of handhelds. From LSDJ, to a modern DAW and MIDI, we'll cover the most popular methods used today and their strengths and weaknesses, as well as hardware needed to accommodate it all!

name: Neko Mania - Cat Culture in Japan
description: Meow! Do you love cats? Come learn all about our furry friends long and storied history in Japanese culture from the dusty past to the video game and YouTube stars of today! BYODM- Bring your own dead mouse!

name: Sharing Your D&D Creations for Fun (and Profit?)!
description: Did you know you can write for Dungeons & Dragons and get paid for it? Wizards of the Coast permits you to sell your D&D creations through a variety of digital marketplaces, and it’s never been easier to get your adventures, homebrews, and original worlds to a wider audience. Join the Mythmakers team as we discuss tips and tricks on how to make a splash on the platform!

name: Mighty Gunvolt Burst
description:
CritsKrieger plays through the energetic Mighty Gunvolt Burst as the character of your donation's choosing!

10:50AM - 12:20PM

name: Flash Beats

name: Lylat Legacy: The Musical History of Star Fox
description: Whether you’re a Star Fox noob or a veteran Arwing flyer, this panel will thoroughly help you prepare for this year's Star Fox themed MAGFest! Immerse yourself in the musical history of the franchise from a theoretical standpoint, seeing how it has a direct correlation with Nintendo’s goals for each game as the series has developed. It’ll start with analyzing the original musical ideas and instrumentation from the ‘original trilogy’, look at how those motifs and orchestrations changed and developed while also keeping some continuity up until present, and all while directly tying this into Nintendo’s marketing of the franchise.

name: Art History 101 for Gamers
description: Join four Smithsonian panelists to talk about video games, art, and American history in this crash course on art history-- for gamers!

name: Ask your favorite Nerdcore Artist!
description: Join in on this powerhouse Q&A Spectacular featuring MC Front Alot, Mega Ran, Schaffer the Dark Lord, Wreck the System, and other surprise guests as they talk about their careers as nerdy MCs and take questions from fans!

name: Being Massively Effective at Queer Representation – Where Do We Go Next?
description: While games are becoming increasingly more inclusive towards underrepresented groups, so much of the discussion is about what is being done poorly, or simply not enough. Wouldn’t it be refreshing to turn the discourse around and use it to find actual strategies for making things better? This panel explores how games are being researched today as vehicles for social change, and more importantly, exactly what is being done WELL so that we can use that data to continue making positive progress. We will also include some discussion on what it is that differentiates positive representation in games from tokenism and how we can advocate for the form

name: The Ocarina Panel ft. Ocabanda

name: The Video Game Music Sound

description: The topic of the panel is how VG music can change your life for the better.  Music is a highly influential manipulator of emotions and can heighten a gaming experience.  Soundtracks are becoming increasingly significant, and many melodies are familiar to most people of a gaming background.

name: The Secret World of Game Engines
description: Game engines are the magic behind all our favorite games. This talk will bring you up to speed on the current state of engines and review some of the history behind them. There will also be live demos of some game engines to help demonstrate how they work.

name: Armour Academy: Japanese Ring Mail!
description:
We will teach the basics of traditional Japanese-style Kusari weaving, a type of armor both similar to and notably different from western Chainmail. We'll teach you the basic So Kusari and Hana Kusari weaves, and send you home with a small piece forged by your own hands!
There will be a fifteen dollar materials fee to participate in this panel, but any may observe for free!

This panel will consist of a presentation and a group discussion, followed by answering questions from the audience.

name: Yoga for Gamers
description: Reflect, restore, and reboot your personal "system"-- your body-mind-breath complex. Join me in an all-welcome, all-levels meditation and movement practice, accompanied by gaming themes and music for inspiration. This isn't about "exercising"; it's about  connecting the circuits within yourself, and observing the nature of the mind as it renders your personal gameworld. Self-awareness = Choice. Choose your adventure.

name: COUCH STUFF
description: Did you know there's a Gaming Couch™?  Did you know we have games to play on said couch?  Did you know we're going to move the couch to the theatre and play games there?  Now you know!

name: From “Get Tough” to “Get Cute”: Pac-Man and Women in Early Video Games
description:
In 1980, Toru Iwatani sought to change the face of arcades in Japan by developing a colorful game with a simple control scheme--Pac-Man. Iwatani’s goal was to encourage more women to go to arcades; however, in the United States, the release of Pac-Man led to more women both in the arcades and behind the scenes, in addition to inventing a new genre of video gaming. Video game historian Anne Ladyem McDivitt dives into the influence of Pac-Man on game development and how more women engaged with gaming in the early 1980s.

Panelist:
Anne Ladyem McDivitt is the Digital Humanities Librarian at the University of Alabama, and her research is on video games in the 1970s and 1980s, gender, and culture. She received her PhD in history from George Mason University with her dissertation is “We Take Fun Seriously: The Creation of the Video Game Industry in the United States,” which focuses on the history of the early video game industry and the people who created them. She also co-hosts a podcast about video games, anime, and manga called “Seasonal Anime Checkup OVA.”

name: Games and the Government
description: Your tax dollars at work! Government agencies are hard at work all across Washington, DC creating games for learning, change and impact! Join a panel of experts from the US Department of Education, the National Endowment for the Arts, the National Endowment of the Humanities and the Wilson Center to learn  how games are supported in government. Get familiar with a growing network known as the Federal Games Guild!

name: Takashi Tateishi: Composing for Mega Man 2
description: Mega Man 2 composer Takashi Tateishi talks about composing for Mega Man 2, as well as his work after that at Konami and Most Company.

name: Falling in love with your fridge - dating games and their seduction techniques
description: Pigeons, tanks, dinosaurs, alpacas - dating sims allow us to romance all of them, somehow making us go from "no!" to "whoa!", laughing and crying as our relationships develop. Outstar, Twitch streamer and developer of Cold Hearts -visual novel about romancing refrigerators - shares behind the scenes tidbits of creating emotional connections with very untypical lovers.

name: Live-streaming for everyone
description: An A-Z, Q&A with professional streamers on creating content, attracting an audience and more

name: Memes are ILLEGAL (Intellectual Property 101)
description: Why are memes illegal? What is the DMCA? Are lootboxes legal? Can I cover a song on stream? It’s not fun being smacked by the long arm of the law, so come learn from fellow geeks and gamers (who just happen to also be lawyers) about Intellectual Property law and how it affects your hobbies and careers. They’ll talk about the basics of copyright, trademark, and other IP concerns, and how to stay on the right side of intellectual property law.

name: Drive robots, Make/shoot pneumatic rockets, 3D Printing demonstrations
description: Come see and try out various types of robots from Lego, VEX and FIRST.  Make paper rockets and shoot them with our air powered launcher.  We’ll also be doing some 3D printing and showing attendees how we scan and use CAD to create original designs.

QuadraTron Games

Radical Robot Squad - Radical Robot Squad is about fighting giant robos, using those to make the best Mega Mech, and then pitting one Mega Mech against another!

Silverclutch Games
Beneath Nexus - Destroy your friends as the Blight Lord or work together as mighty heroes in this asymmetrical dungeon crawler for 3 to 6 players!
Heavy Armor - Deploy your Armors to combat your opposing commander in this strategic space opera inspired by mecha anime!

Phase Shift - Robots! Lasers! Wizards! Explosions! Roll the dice and go on a grand space adventure in this tabletop RPG!

12:30 - 2:00PM

name: Undertale Music Cover Videos: Exploring the ways VGM inspires musicians to learn, create, and collaborate through YouTube
description: This panel presents a multiple case study of YouTube musicians who used Undertale as inspiration to create music videos and publish them online. Hear from the musicians themselves, moderated by a YouTube scholar and researcher, in this discussion in which the panel talks about online learning strategies, creative processes, and working with others virtually. While the focus will be on Undertale as a subject and YouTube as a medium, the conversation will also address other techniques that led to success for the participants including expanding to other media, collaborative/collective virtual music groups, and balancing VGM with other hobbies or jobs.

name: Evolution Through Art! Using Games and Art to Teach Evolution
description: Evolution is a topic that can be generally taught late in a student’s school career, and in some cases is avoided altogether, especially in the South. Because of this, general information about biology can be glossed over or totally absent, even until students get to the college level. One way to convey this information in a fun and interesting way that appeals to all levels of understanding is through games! I’ve come up with a collaborative art game that can be played in groups that simulates evolution using art that YOU draw LIVE on paper! I hope you’ll join us!

name: How To Build an Indie Arcade Cabinet
description: DBA Arcade would like to present a panel on how to build an indie arcade cabinet....while simultaneously building an indie arcade cabinet! This panel will be two parts: a few members of the team including the game developer will walk the audience through the process of designing and building an indie arcade cabinet from scratch. At the same time, a crew of builders will assemble this cabinet (prepped mostly in advance)

Join them for a night of twist, turns, comebacks, and robot drop kicks.

name: So You Wanna Play Yu-Gi-Oh? In This Economy?!
description: Players of a children's card game discuss some fundamentals of economics using the buying and selling of Yu-Gi-Oh! cards and building a deck as examples. Topics include supply and demand, scarcity, opportunity costs, etc. Whether you want to learn about economics or how to build a usable deck without breaking the bank, this is the panel for you!

name: The Rediscovered History of RCA's Video Games and Computers
description:
RCA's Studio II was its lone, failed venture into the video game industry, seemingly little more than a footnote compared to its competition, such as the Atari 2600. There's more to the story, though: recent research into its design history has unveiled home computer prototypes dating back to 1970, arcade machines, the work of the first female indie developer, and even the first glimpses of the internet. Join game historian Kevin Bunch and curator Florencia Pierri as they discuss some of their findings and show off some previously lost games, demos, and hardware in action!

After the panel, Kevin Bunch and Florencia Pierri will provide a close-up tour with RCA hardware at the MAGFest Museum.

Panelists:
Kevin Bunch is a science writer and video game historian focused on the early days of the medium. He is the creator of the Atari Archive video series on YouTube, which looks at each game for the Atari 2600 in release order with occasional tangents into related topics, such as the history of the RCA Studio II.

Florencia Pierri is a historian of technology and the curator at the Sarnoff Collection at The College of New Jersey.

name: Beyond the 101 Diversity Convo
description: Let's discuss inclusion and diversity beyond the 101, yes diversity is needed level. Let's discuss better ways to make gaming (video, ttrpg, etc) more inclusive aside from let's find one brown person, one queer person, one woman, etc. Let's talk solutions rather than reconfirming the problem exists.

name: Composing Within The Team
description: Lena Raine has worked in the game industry for 12 years, in roles ranging from QA to Game Design, as well as her current role as a freelance composer. In this talk, she'll discuss what benefits and challenges arise from being a composer within the development team, and her own experiences with this on multiple projects of varying sizes.

name: Video Game Name That Tune
description: Let battle be joined for the 14th MAGFest Name That Tune competition. Play along in the audience or throw your name in the hat to be a contestant as we take a bloodthirsty journey through VGM history!

name: What is the future of VR/AR/MR?
description: We have talked about the past and explored the present, so what will be the future of Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality and Mixed Reality? Will our dreams be fulfilled, or will the future go beyond our imaginations. Our visionaries will lead the group discussion, with audience participation, of what we should expect in the near and distant future.

name: 'It's in The Cards!' -- Divination, The Game Everyone Knows
description: Divination became a game, as early as the 14th century.  Mamluk, Tarot's early Egyptian predecessor, possessed two methods of gameplay, also appearing later in 15th century Italy by the 'tarocchi appropriati'.  These two game mechanics (point-gathering and divination) have survived in our collective awareness by modern-day Bridge and subcultures seeking to communicate with the spirit realm via intuition.  Join our discussion on Tarot's function in and influence on contemporary gaming.  We'll also look into Yu-Gi-Oh's cultural influence as an occult tool of divination, even asking the deck if a suitable, audience volunteer is present for a 'Yu-Gi-Oh reading'.

name: How to Make a Game in 48 Hours
description: If you’ve ever wanted to make a game but don’t know where to start, we have the solution for you: game jams! A game jam is a rapid game development event – usually happening over the course of a weekend – where developers both new and old come together to make games! Game jams are a great way for aspiring game developers to get started or for seasoned pros to learn something new. Join our panel of game jam coordinators and participants as we discuss how to participate in a jam and how to get the most out of one.

name: Introduction to foam armor workshop
description: Introduction to foam armor workshop - come learn how to work with EVA foam, craft foam, and thermoplastics! This workshop will take you through the basics of patterning, cutting, and shaping EVA armor.

name: Gotta Catch Em All: Pokemon, Persona, and Japanese Mythology
description: Pokemon is the largest and best known Japanese RPG franchise of all time. Yokai Watch is a series geared at children that encourages exploration, collection, and mythology. Persona (and Shin Megami Tensei as a whole) adds world-spanning conflict and divine entities to the mix. All these series have their roots in myths, adopt the Japanese love of collecting and battling, and maintain strong fanbases because of it. This lecture will explore the mythical connections, Japan's obsession with collecting monsters, and how each of the three series adapt the same formula in unique ways.

name: FutureMakers Light Painting
description: Freeze space and time by creating long exposure photographs!  Perfect for families, kids and makers of all ages - Paint with light brushes, and send your photos to friends! Brought to you by the coaches at FutureMakers!

name: Building Inclusive Community with Table-Top Gaming: How D&D Can Force Loneliness into Death Saving Throws
description:
Looking for community, but unsure where to find it?

We want to share with you our experiences of building inclusive community around board games, comics and Dungeons & Dragons and field questions to help you be a super-duper community includer!

We'll cover how to create a welcoming environment for anyone to step in and play; what prevents people from joining gaming communities; why inclusive communities are important to us, nerd culture and the future.

*Part group lecture, part Q&A*

name: RCA Hardware Tour
description: After the panel "The Rediscovered History of RCA's Video Games and Computers," join video game historian Kevin Bunch and Sarnoff Collection curator Florencia Pierri at the MAGFest Museum for a close-up look at RCA's computer and video game hardware. This tour includes a chance to play a 1977 RCA Studio II and a look at hardware prototypes never seen outside a museum!
