description:
Please show up 10 mins in advance to the Ops desk in the Smash Zone.

Tournaments are limited to 32 people and may last longer than an hour.

name: Iron Jams Performances
description: A feedback and judging session where our Iron Jams teams will perform their arrangements live! Spectators are welcome to view the performances!

name: VIDEO GAME VOICE ACTING WORKSHOP
description:
If you've ever asked at a Video Game Voice Actor Panel, "How do I get into Voice Acting?" then THIS is the panel you MUST ATTEND.

Learn from the Pros as you read from real video game scripts and get pointers on how to improve your skills.

(Teachers TBD)

name: Cosplight
description:
Not sure where to start with lighting your cosplay? Is your prop too heavy? Just not sure how to make it more manageable? Then this Q&A is for you! Shed some light on your cosplights and get some bright advice.

Bring your cosplay related problems or questions to get sound advice on solving them. From powering electronics, to creating lighting effects using Arduino, to basic mechatronics, we have the knowledge to bring your idea to life.

name: OMG, just go outside! Using gaming to connect kids with nature
description:
Let’s be real- we all love gaming but we also need to spend time outside. Time spent outdoors helps increase focus, reduce stress, and can help to improve physical and mental health. Learn how environmental educators are both harnessing their love of gaming to get people of all ages up and moving while learning about, playing in, and conserving nature.  
 
What do Pokemon and iNaturalist have in common? How did D&D inspire a lesson about survival skills? Do you think about real-life adaptations when monster-making? After hearing what they’re doing, spend some time doing Q&A, or bring up your own ideas!

name: Mega Man-athon Outro!
description: That's a wrap for the Mega Man-athon at MAGFest! See you next year for our very first MAGFast!

name: The 40 Games You Must Play
description: These may not be the top 40 games ever designed, nor are they the top 40 influential or otherwise important games. If you aspire to really understand games, or if you have visions of designing your own, these are 40 games that, if you play them, will give you the widest possible perspective on what it means to make a good game (and what "good" even means).

name: Are You Re@dy M@gfest? An Intro to Idolm@ster
description: Idolm@ster is a multimedia franchise created by Bandai Namco in 2005 that consists of video games, anime, manga, and live concert performances. But where is a good place to start? What's the difference between Million Live and Cinderella Girls? And how does one keep track of all these idols? Join us for a crash course on one of the most versatile idol franchises to come out of Japan!

name: Open and Guided Jams
description:
Bring your instrument (or try our in-house gear), grab a microphone, and get ready to jam with our highly-talented staff and guests! Or just swing by and enjoy the live music! Not sure where to start, or want to brush up on your chops? We have workshops scheduled throughout the weekend for all skill levels.

Note: time ranges for Open and Guided Jams may vary slightly due to scheduled events in the Jam Clinic and Jam Shop.

~~~

The Jam Clinic is a musician-to-musician education venue at the Music and Gaming Festival (MAGFest), dedicated to co-mentoring participants on how to play and improvise within genres such as jazz fusion, funk, and rock, as well as popular video game music.

We strive to teach participants and empower them with the language of musical communication, while embracing a leadership-centered, technology-powered, challenging, and fun atmosphere for our visitors.

name: Cosplay 201: Cosplay Photography
description: Even on a cheap camera or a cell phone, it IS possible to get a good shot of your cosplay- if you understand some basic photography principles, that is! For the first 45 minutes, we will be going over photography essentials with both a DSLR or your cell phone's camera in mind, followed by 45 minutes of practice with some cosplay models (and each other, if you choose). All participants who wish their own photo taken can receive one free touched up photo (with notes) at a later date.

name: MAME Roulette Live!
description: MAME Roulette is a stream where one man, Matt “LordBBH” Hall, plays thousands of different arcade games chosen randomly. Now Matt and freelance game journalist Heidi Kemps bring the madness to MAGfest! Watch as we explore the weird and wonderful world of 40-plus years of arcade history by not knowing what the heck is going to turn up! Even better — the audience will have a chance to play the randomly chosen games as well! Will we all be playing a parade of obscure gems, a bunch of bizarre, inexplicable jank, or both? Come by and find out!

name: Plastic Rock: Histoty of Guitar Hero Through the Fire and Flames (Ages)
description:
Ever wanted to learn where Guitar Hero came from? Special Guitar Hero Techniques you didn't know existed? What does the future of this beloved Rhythm Game Series hold? Then this is the panel for you!
From the Harmonix Era, to the Activision Era, and finally to Clone Hero, this panel will educate you on how to be a Guitar Hero!

name: Influential VG Characters to Women, Minorities & LGBT
description: Join us as we explore the representation and misrepresentation of women, LGBT and other minority groups in video games from past to present

name: Esports 102: How to Obtain Team and Personal Sponsors
description: In this panel, Mikomi from Pridestark Gaming will talk about how gamers and managers can reach out to companies to obtain sponsorships and backing for their Esports endeavors.

name: MITS Closes
description: MITS Closes until next year!
